storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view resource availability in real-time to make informed scheduling decisions

testCases.title: Verify real-time resource availability display
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling interface is accessible
At least one resource exists in the system with existing bookings
Database contains current booking data
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling interface loads successfully and displays the resource selection panel

steps.action: Select a specific resource from the resource list
steps.expectedResult: Availability calendar displays for the selected resource showing current bookings in occupied slots and free slots clearly marked as available

steps.action: Verify the calendar shows existing bookings with time slots and booking details
steps.expectedResult: All current bookings are visible with accurate time ranges, and free slots are distinguishable from booked slots

steps.action: Create a new booking for the selected resource by choosing an available time slot and saving
steps.expectedResult: Booking is created successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Observe the availability calendar without refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: Availability calendar updates within 1 second to reflect the new booking, showing the previously free slot now as occupied

steps.action: Click on the resource type filter dropdown and select a specific resource type
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates immediately to display only resources matching the selected type with their respective availability

steps.action: Clear the filter or select a different resource type
steps.expectedResult: Calendar refreshes to show the newly filtered set of resources with accurate availability data

postconditions: New booking is saved in the database
Availability calendar reflects all current bookings accurately
Filter settings can be reset or modified for subsequent searches
System remains in ready state for additional scheduling operations

testCases.title: Ensure availability data refresh latency under 1 second
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling interface is open with a resource availability view displayed
Access to modify bookings externally (via API or another user session)
System monitoring tools or browser developer tools available to measure response time
At least one resource with existing bookings is available

steps.action: Open the availability calendar for a specific resource in the scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Availability calendar displays with current bookings and free slots

steps.action: Using an external method (API call, different user session, or admin panel), create a new booking for the same resource
steps.expectedResult: External booking is successfully created in the system

steps.action: Start a timer and observe the availability view in the original session without manual refresh
steps.expectedResult: Availability view automatically updates within 1 second to show the new booking created externally

steps.action: Externally modify an existing booking (change time or cancel) for the resource being viewed
steps.expectedResult: Modified booking change is saved successfully in the system

steps.action: Observe the UI response time for the availability update
steps.expectedResult: UI updates within 1 second with no noticeable delay, displaying the modified booking information

steps.action: Compare the displayed availability data with the actual booking records in the database or via API query
steps.expectedResult: Displayed availability matches actual bookings exactly with 100% accuracy - all booked slots, free slots, and booking details are correct

steps.action: Perform multiple rapid external booking changes and monitor UI updates
steps.expectedResult: Each change is reflected in the UI within 1 second, maintaining data accuracy throughout

postconditions: All external booking modifications are accurately reflected in the availability view
System maintains real-time synchronization between database and UI
Performance metrics confirm sub-1-second refresh latency
No data inconsistencies exist between displayed and actual availability

testCases.title: Test integration of availability view with scheduling form
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling interface and availability calendar are accessible
Resources exist with both available and unavailable time slots
Scheduling form is functional and integrated with availability view
Conflict detection system is active

steps.action: Open the scheduling interface and display the availability calendar for a resource
steps.expectedResult: Availability calendar loads showing current bookings and free slots

steps.action: Click on an available (free) time slot in the availability calendar
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form opens or becomes active with the selected resource and time slot pre-filled automatically

steps.action: Verify that the resource name, date, start time, and end time fields in the scheduling form match the selected slot
steps.expectedResult: All fields are accurately pre-populated with the selected resource and time slot information

steps.action: Navigate back to the availability calendar and click on a time slot that is already booked (unavailable)
steps.expectedResult: System prevents the scheduling form from opening for booking, or opens the form in view-only mode showing existing booking details

steps.action: Attempt to manually modify the scheduling form to book the unavailable slot by changing the time to overlap with an existing booking
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and prevents the booking action, displaying a conflict alert message indicating the resource is unavailable for the selected time

steps.action: Review the conflict alert message for clarity and actionable information
steps.expectedResult: Alert clearly states the conflict reason, shows the conflicting booking details, and suggests alternative available time slots

steps.action: Select a different available time slot from the calendar and complete the booking form with all required information
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form accepts all inputs without conflict warnings

steps.action: Submit the booking for the available slot
steps.expectedResult: Booking succeeds without any conflict errors, confirmation message is displayed, and the new booking appears in the availability calendar

steps.action: Verify the availability calendar updates to show the newly booked slot as unavailable
steps.expectedResult: Calendar reflects the new booking immediately, showing the slot as occupied

postconditions: New booking is successfully saved in the system
Availability calendar accurately reflects all bookings including the new one
No conflicting bookings exist for the resource
Conflict detection system remains active for future booking attempts
System is ready for additional scheduling operations

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to prevent saving schedules with conflicts unless authorized to override

testCases.title: Block save on conflicting schedule without override
preconditions: User is logged in with standard Scheduler role without override authorization
Scheduling interface is accessible
At least one resource exists with an existing booking
Conflict detection system is enabled and functional
User does not have override permissions in their role

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface and open the booking form
steps.expectedResult: Booking form loads successfully with all required fields available

steps.action: Select a resource that already has a booking for a specific time slot
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and available for scheduling attempt

steps.action: Enter booking details that create a time conflict with the existing booking (overlapping start/end times)
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input and allows proceeding to save

steps.action: Click the Save button to attempt saving the conflicting schedule
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict, blocks the save operation, and displays a clear conflict error message indicating the resource is already booked for the selected time

steps.action: Verify that no override option or button is presented to the non-authorized user
steps.expectedResult: Override option is not visible or accessible, confirming proper role-based access control

steps.action: Attempt to bypass the block by resubmitting the form multiple times or using browser refresh
steps.expectedResult: System consistently prevents the save operation, displaying the conflict message each time without allowing the conflicting schedule to be saved

steps.action: Check the database or booking list to verify the conflicting schedule was not saved
steps.expectedResult: No new conflicting booking exists in the system; only the original booking remains, confirming the save was successfully blocked

steps.action: Verify the original booking remains unchanged and intact
steps.expectedResult: Original booking data is unaffected and remains accurate in the system

postconditions: No conflicting schedule is saved in the database
Original booking remains intact and unchanged
User receives clear feedback about why the save was blocked
System maintains schedule integrity
Audit log shows the blocked save attempt (if logging is implemented for failed attempts)

testCases.title: Allow override save for authorized user
preconditions: User is logged in with a role that has override authorization (e.g., Senior Scheduler, Manager)
Scheduling interface is accessible
At least one resource exists with an existing booking creating a conflict scenario
Conflict detection and override system are enabled
Audit logging system is active and functional
User has valid authorization credentials

steps.action: Log in as an authorized user with override permissions
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and has access to scheduling interface with override capabilities

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface and create a booking that conflicts with an existing schedule
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is filled with conflicting time slot details

steps.action: Click the Save button to attempt saving the conflicting schedule
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays a conflict warning message along with an 'Override' option button clearly visible to the authorized user

steps.action: Verify the override option is presented with appropriate warning text about the implications of overriding
steps.expectedResult: Override button is visible with warning text explaining that proceeding will create a conflicting schedule

steps.action: Click the Override button to proceed with the conflicting save
steps.expectedResult: System prompts for authorization credentials (password re-entry, confirmation dialog, or additional authentication)

steps.action: Enter valid authorization credentials and confirm the override action
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted, and the system processes the override request

steps.action: Submit the override confirmation
steps.expectedResult: Conflicting schedule is saved successfully, and a confirmation message is displayed indicating the override was successful

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log or system logs section
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads successfully

steps.action: Search for the most recent override action entry in the audit log
steps.expectedResult: Override action is logged with complete details including user identity (username/ID), timestamp (date and time), resource affected, conflicting booking details, and override reason if captured

steps.action: Verify the logged entry contains all required information and is accurate
steps.expectedResult: All override details are accurately recorded with correct user information and precise timestamp

steps.action: Check the scheduling view to confirm both the original and new conflicting bookings are now visible
steps.expectedResult: Both bookings are displayed in the system, showing the conflict exists as an override

postconditions: Conflicting schedule is successfully saved in the database
Both original and overridden bookings exist in the system
Override action is fully logged in audit trail with user and timestamp
System maintains data integrity despite the conflict
Authorization credentials are not stored in logs
User can continue with normal scheduling operations

testCases.title: Send notifications on override save
preconditions: User is logged in with override authorization role
Scheduling interface is accessible
Notification system is configured and operational
Stakeholder contact information (email/phone) is configured in the system
At least one stakeholder is designated to receive override notifications
A conflicting booking scenario exists
Email/notification service is active and reachable

steps.action: Log in as an authorized user and navigate to the scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: User is logged in successfully with override permissions and scheduling interface is displayed

steps.action: Create a booking that conflicts with an existing schedule
steps.expectedResult: Conflicting booking details are entered in the form

steps.action: Attempt to save the conflicting schedule and click the Override option when presented
steps.expectedResult: Override option is displayed and selected

steps.action: Provide authorization credentials and confirm the override action to complete the save
steps.expectedResult: Override is processed successfully, conflicting schedule is saved, and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Wait for notification processing (typically a few seconds) and check the notification queue or logs
steps.expectedResult: System triggers notification sending process immediately after override save completion

steps.action: Access the stakeholder's notification inbox (email, system notifications, or SMS) designated to receive override alerts
steps.expectedResult: Notification is sent to all configured stakeholders

steps.action: Open and review the notification content
steps.expectedResult: Notification includes complete override details: user who performed the override (name and ID), timestamp of override action, resource affected, original booking details, new conflicting booking details, and reason for override if provided

steps.action: Verify the notification subject line clearly indicates it is an override alert
steps.expectedResult: Subject line is clear and descriptive (e.g., 'Schedule Override Alert: Conflicting Booking Created')

steps.action: Check the timestamp of notification delivery against the override action timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Notification is delivered promptly within acceptable timeframe (within 1-2 minutes of override action), confirming stakeholders receive timely alerts

steps.action: Verify all designated stakeholders received the notification
steps.expectedResult: All configured stakeholders have received the notification successfully without delivery failures

steps.action: Check notification logs or delivery status in the system
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery is logged with successful delivery status for each recipient

postconditions: Override save is completed and recorded
Notifications are successfully sent to all stakeholders
Notification delivery is logged in the system
Stakeholders are informed of the override action with complete details
System is ready to send notifications for future override actions
No notification delivery errors are present

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to provide alternative time slot suggestions when conflicts occur to facilitate quick rescheduling

testCases.title: Verify alternative time slot suggestions generation
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least one resource is available in the system
Resource calendars contain both occupied and free time slots
Scheduling form is accessible and functional
System has access to Resource availability API

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling form and enter booking details (resource, date, time) that create a scheduling conflict with an existing booking
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and triggers alternative time slot suggestion generation

steps.action: Start timer and wait for system to generate alternative time slot suggestions
steps.expectedResult: System generates and displays multiple alternative time slot suggestions within 2 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Review the list of suggested alternative time slots displayed by the system
steps.expectedResult: All suggested slots are valid, available, and conflict-free with existing bookings for the selected resource

steps.action: Select one of the alternative time slots from the suggestions list
steps.expectedResult: Selected alternative slot is highlighted and system prepares to update the scheduling form

steps.action: Confirm the selection of the alternative slot
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form automatically updates with the selected alternative slot details including date and time fields

postconditions: Scheduling form displays the selected alternative time slot
No conflict warnings are present
Form is ready for final submission
Original conflicting time slot is no longer selected

testCases.title: Test application of selected alternative slot
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
A scheduling conflict has been detected
Alternative time slot suggestions have been generated and displayed
At least one valid alternative slot is available for selection
Scheduling form is in editable state

steps.action: From the displayed alternative time slot suggestions, click on a preferred alternative slot
steps.expectedResult: Selected alternative slot is highlighted and marked as chosen

steps.action: Observe the scheduling form fields after selection
steps.expectedResult: All scheduling form fields (date, time, duration, resource) update automatically to reflect the selected alternative slot details

steps.action: Verify that all form fields contain correct information from the selected alternative
steps.expectedResult: Date field shows alternative date, time field shows alternative time, resource remains the same, and all other relevant fields are populated correctly

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button to complete the booking with the alternative slot
steps.expectedResult: System processes the booking request and saves the schedule successfully

steps.action: Wait for confirmation message and check for any conflict alerts or error messages
steps.expectedResult: Booking is saved successfully without any conflicts, confirmation message is displayed, and no conflict alerts or error messages appear

steps.action: Navigate to the resource calendar or schedule view to verify the booking
steps.expectedResult: New booking appears in the calendar at the selected alternative time slot with correct details and no overlapping conflicts

postconditions: Booking is successfully saved in the system
Resource calendar reflects the new booking at alternative time slot
No scheduling conflicts exist
Confirmation of successful booking is displayed
System returns to normal scheduling state

testCases.title: Ensure suggestion generation performance
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Multiple resources with varying availability exist in the system
System performance monitoring tools are available
Resource availability API is operational
Network connection is stable
System is under normal load conditions

steps.action: Open the scheduling form and enter booking details that will create a conflict with existing bookings
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict and initiates alternative slot suggestion process

steps.action: Start a timer or use browser developer tools to measure response time when conflict is detected
steps.expectedResult: Timer starts accurately at the moment of conflict detection

steps.action: Wait for alternative time slot suggestions to be generated and displayed
steps.expectedResult: Alternative time slot suggestions are returned and displayed within 2 seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Record the exact time taken for suggestion generation
steps.expectedResult: Recorded time is at or below 2 seconds threshold

steps.action: Monitor system performance metrics including CPU usage, memory consumption, and API response times during suggestion generation
steps.expectedResult: No significant degradation in system performance is observed, all metrics remain within acceptable ranges

steps.action: Review each suggested alternative time slot for accuracy by cross-referencing with resource calendars
steps.expectedResult: All suggested slots are verified as conflict-free and accurately reflect actual resource availability

steps.action: Repeat the test with different resources and time periods to ensure consistent performance
steps.expectedResult: Suggestion generation consistently completes within 2 seconds across multiple test scenarios

postconditions: System performance remains stable
All suggested alternatives are verified as accurate and conflict-free
Performance metrics are documented and within acceptable thresholds
No system errors or timeouts occurred
Response time consistently meets the 2-second requirement
